title: 111_hr4512
content:
The Act is titled the "Country-of-Origin Labeling for Fuels Act" and includes definitions for various terms. The "Country-of-Origin Labeling for Fuels Act" defines key terms including country-of-origin information, motor vehicle fuel, and motor vehicle fuel retailer. The "Country-of-Origin Labeling for Fuels Act" defines key terms related to motor vehicle fuel supply chain, including motor vehicle fuel retailer and motor vehicle fuel supplier. The "Country-of-Origin Labeling for Fuels Act" defines terms related to motor vehicle fuel supply chain, including retailer and supplier. It also calls for a study on implementing country-of-origin labeling for motor vehicle fuel. The "Country-of-Origin Labeling for Fuels Act" requires the Secretary of Energy, in consultation with the EPA Administrator, to conduct a study on methods for disclosing country-of-origin information for motor vehicle fuel suppliers and retailers to consumers. The study will also make recommendations on feasible and cost-effective disclosure requirements. The study required by the "Country-of-Origin Labeling for Fuels Act" will assess access to country-of-origin information in the motor vehicle fuel supply chain. It will determine if this information is adequate for suppliers to pass on to the next step in the chain and for retailers to display to consumers. The study will evaluate the adequacy of country-of-origin information in the motor vehicle fuel supply chain for suppliers and retailers to disclose to consumers. It will also assess the feasibility of displaying this information at fuel pumps and on retailer websites. The Secretary will report to Congress within 90 days after completing a study on motor vehicle fuel country-of-origin information disclosure requirements, summarizing the results and containing recommendations. SEC. 4. REGULATIONS REQUIRING COUNTRY-OF-ORIGIN INFORMATION DISCLOSURE.

The Secretary of Energy, in consultation with the EPA Administrator, must create regulations within 180 days of submitting a report, mandating country-of-origin disclosure by motor vehicle fuel suppliers and retailers. The regulations will specify that for fuel blends with 70 percent or more originating from a single country, only one country needs to be listed.

SEC. 5. ENFORCEMENT. The Secretary of Energy can impose a civil penalty of up to $10,000 on a person who knowingly violates regulations under section 4, after providing notice and if the violation continues for more than 30 days. When determining the penalty for violating regulations under section 4, the Secretary considers the severity of the violation, the size of the business, and the impact on the ability to continue operating.
